Description: Weight: half-dīnār. Five line inscription on obverse and one line marginal and two line central inscription on reverse. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: See also OA+ 4198, OA+ 4238 and 1885,1007.1. From the same reverse of die: Petrie, W.M.F. 1926. ‘Glass stamps and weights’. London, 167; Miles, G.C. 1948. ‘Early Arabic Weights and Stamps’. New York, 80; Fahmi, A. 1957. ‘Sinaj al-sikka fī fajr al-Islām’. Cairo, 146-7.

There appears to be only one half-dīnār die of Yazīd b. Ḥātim. It has been found with the same reverse in its first state and also with the reverses of Muḥammad b. Shuraḥbīl and Kamil and Salama and Severus.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (240)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Yazīd b. Ḥātim
Named in inscription: 'Abd al-Raḥmān b. Yazīd
